{{cpp/chrono/year/title|1=min}}
{{cpp/chrono/year/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|1=
static constexpr std::chrono::year min() noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns the smallest possible {{tt|year}}, that is, {{c|std::chrono::year(-32767)}}.

===Return value===
{{c|std::chrono::year(-32767)}}

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;chrono&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;

int main()
{
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "The minimum year is: " &lt;&lt; (int)std::chrono::year::min() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
The minimum year is: -32767
}}
